key_points: Alicia Ball in Mississippi is caring for her unvaccinated husband, William, battling Covid-19.
William has been in the hospital for over 22 days, intensifying concerns about the Delta variant's impact on unvaccinated individuals.
Alicia, who was vaccinated, recovered from Covid-19 in 10 days, showcasing the vaccine's effectiveness.
The couple was initially hesitant to get vaccinated due to lack of information on the virus's severity and the vaccine's effects.
Alicia decided to get vaccinated due to her asthma condition, under her doctor's care.
Mississippi, where the Balls reside, has one of the lowest vaccination rates in the U.S., with only 34.4% of the population fully vaccinated.
The state is experiencing high transmission rates of Covid-19, with 336 cases per 100,000 people.
The Delta variant is spreading across the U.S., leading to increased safety restrictions and mask guidance.
Fully vaccinated individuals can still contract the Delta variant, but symptoms are typically milder.
Alicia Ball hopes sharing her story will encourage others, including family, friends, and church members, to get vaccinated.
